intro: Viguiera iltisii, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flower clusters that bloom in late summer and early fall. Viguiera iltisii is often found in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
